summary: The South African national cricket team, nicknamed the Proteas is administered by Cricket South Africa. South Africa is a full member of the International Cricket Council (ICC) with Test, One Day International (ODI) and Twenty20 International (T20I) status.

translations.title: दक्षिण अफ्रीका की राष्ट्रीय क्रिकेट टीम

Cricket South Africa
Faf du Plessis
Faf du Plessis

Ottis Gibson
The Wanderers Stadium is a stadium situated in Johannesburg, South Africa. Test, One Day and First class cricket matches are played here.

image.license: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 2.0 Generic license.

value.label: The oldest cricket club in South Africa is the Port Elizabeth Cricket Club, founded in 1843.
Sir Donald Currie sponsored the first English team to tour South Africa.
The South African cricket team toured Australia for the first time in 1910–11.
As of 15 March 2018, the ICC ranks South Africa second in Tests, second in ODIs and seventh in T20Is, as well as sixth in the women's overall championship

Hashim Mohammad Amla is a South African international cricketer who plays for South Africa in all three formats of the game. He is a right-handed batsman and holds the record for the highest individual Test score of any South African batsman.

value.label: Quinton de Kock is a South African professional cricketer. He also plays for Mumbai Indians in Indian Premier League. He was named the Cricketer of the Year at Cricket South Africa's 2017 Annual Awards.

image.license: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 2.0 Generic license.

value.label: David Miller is the former captain of the Kings XI Punjab in the Indian Premier League (IPL) and represents South Africa in both One Day Internationals (ODIs) and Twenty20 Internationals.

image.license: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 2.0 Generic license.

value.label: Jean-Paul Duminy, often shortened to JP Duminy, is an international South African cricketer. He is vice-captain of the South Africa T20I team. He plays for the IPL cricket team Mumbai Indians.

image.license: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 2.0 Generic license.

value.label: South Africa won the 1998 ICC Champions Trophy
South Africa hosted the 2003 Cricket World Cup
The 2003 Cricket World Cup was the eighth Cricket World Cup, organized by the International Cricket Council (ICC). It was co-hosted by South Africa, Zimbabwe and Kenya.
